Sentencas: This paper examines the electrochemical and direct internal steam-methane reforming performance of the solid oxide fuel cell when subjected to pressurization.
Titulo: Modeling of electrochemistry and steam-methane reforming performance for simulating pressurized solid oxide fuel cell stacks

Sentencas: Pressurized operation boosts the Nernst potential and decreases the activation polarization, both of which serve to increase cell voltage and power while lowering the heat load and operating temperature.
Titulo: Modeling of electrochemistry and steam-methane reforming performance for simulating pressurized solid oxide fuel cell stacks

Sentencas: A model considering the activation polarization in both the fuel and the air electrodes was adopted to address this effect on the electrochemical performance.
Titulo: Modeling of electrochemistry and steam-methane reforming performance for simulating pressurized solid oxide fuel cell stacks

Sentencas: The pressurized methane conversion kinetics and the increase in equilibrium methane concentration are considered in a new rate expression.
Titulo: Modeling of electrochemistry and steam-methane reforming performance for simulating pressurized solid oxide fuel cell stacks

Sentencas: The models were then applied in simulations to predict how the distributions of direct internal reforming rate, temperature, and current density are effected within stacks operating at elevated pressure.
Titulo: Modeling of electrochemistry and steam-methane reforming performance for simulating pressurized solid oxide fuel cell stacks

Sentencas: A generic 10 cm counter-flow stack model was created and used for the simulations of pressurized operation.
Titulo: Modeling of electrochemistry and steam-methane reforming performance for simulating pressurized solid oxide fuel cell stacks

Sentencas: The predictions showed improved thermal and electrical performance with increased operating pressure.
Titulo: Modeling of electrochemistry and steam-methane reforming performance for simulating pressurized solid oxide fuel cell stacks

Sentencas: The average and maximum cell temperatures decreased by 3% (20 degrees C) while the cell voltage increased by 9% as the operating pressure was increased from 1 to 10 atm.
Titulo: Modeling of electrochemistry and steam-methane reforming performance for simulating pressurized solid oxide fuel cell stacks
